org.magelan.drawing
Interface DrawingViewer

All Known Subinterfaces:
DrawingEditor, MarkupViewer
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultDrawingEditor, DefaultDrawingViewer, DefaultMarkupViewer
public interface DrawingViewer

A drawing viewer.

Version:
1.2, 02/2005
Author:
Assen Antov

Method Detail

setModel

void setModel(DrawingModel d)
Sets the drawing model. The parameter model is queried for DrawingRenderer features and the current renderer is set.

Parameters:
d - the new drawing model
See Also:
DrawingModel

getModel

DrawingModel getModel()
Gets the drawing model.

Returns:
the drawing model
See Also:
DrawingModel

Sets the drawing model renderer.

Parameters:

DrawingRenderer

Gets the drawing model renderer.

repaint

void repaint()
Repaints the current view.

Since:
1.1

getContainer

javax.swing.JComponent getContainer()
Returns a JComponent instance that will be used by the viewer to display drawings . The component is constructed by the DrawingViewer implementation and may be used as any other JComponent.

Implementation detail: note that the component will normally be placed in a JScrollPane and therefore must implement the Scrollable interface.

Returns:
a representing JComponent of the viewer

addPropertyChangeListener

void addPropertyChangeListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
Add a PropertyChangeListener to the listener list. The listener is registered for all properties.

Parameters:
listener - the PropertyChangeListener to be added

removePropertyChangeListener

void removePropertyChangeListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
Remove a PropertyChangeListener from the listener list. This removes a PropertyChangeListener that was registered for all properties.

Parameters:
listener - the PropertyChangeListener to be removed

addPropertyChangeListener

void addPropertyChangeListener(java.lang.String propertyName,
                               java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
Add a PropertyChangeListener for a specific property. The listener will be invoked only when a call on firePropertyChange names that specific property.

Parameters:
propertyName - the name of the property to listen on.
listener - the PropertyChangeListener to be added

removePropertyChangeListener

void removePropertyChangeListener(java.lang.String propertyName,
                                  java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
Remove a PropertyChangeListener for a specific property. If listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.

Parameters:
propertyName - the name of the property that was listened on.
listener - the PropertyChangeListener to be removed

putValue

void putValue(java.lang.String key,
              java.lang.Object value)
Sets a property. The method is provided to allow setting of optional properties, such as background color and rendering hints.

Fires a PropertyChangeEvent.

Parameters:
key - property name
value - value of the property or null to delete it

getValue

java.lang.Object getValue(java.lang.String key)
Retrieves a property.

Parameters:
key - property name
Returns:
value of the property

getKeys

java.util.Set getKeys()
Retrieves all property keys. The returned Set is unmodifiable.

Returns:
all available property names
